1.q_string: Two cards from a pack of 52 cards are lost. One card is drawn from the remaining cards. If the drawn card is diamond then the probability that the lost cards were both hearts is:
If four whole numbers taken at random are multiplied together, then the chance that the last digit in the product is 1, 3, 5, 7 is:
Three identical dice are rolled. The probability that the same number will appear on each of them is:

There are four machines and it is known that exactly two of them are faulty. They are tested, one by one, in a random order till both the faulty machines are identified. Then the probability that only two tests are needed is:
Two unbiased dice are thrown. The probability that neither a doubled or a total of 10 will appear is:

Two dice are thrown the events A, B, C are as follows:

A: Getting an odd number on the first die.

B: Getting a total of 7 on the two dice.

C: Getting a total of greater than or equal to 8 on the two dice.

Then AUB is equal to:
Two numbers are chosen from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6} one after another without replacement. Find the probability that the smaller of the two is less than 4.
The probability that when a hand of 7 cards is drawn from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards, it contains 3 Kings is:
The probability that in a random arrangement of the letters of the word INSTITUTION the three T are together is:
Three houses are available in a locality. Three persons apply for the houses. Each applies to one house without consulting others. The probability that all the three apply for the same house is:
A bag contains 5 brown and 4 white socks. A man pulls out two socks. The probability that both the socks are of the same color is:
From eighty cards numbered 1 to 80, two cards are selected randomly. The probability that both the cards have the numbers divisible by 4 is given by:
When a coin is tossed 8 times getting ahead is a success. Then the probability that at least 2 heads will occur is:
A couple has two children. The probability that both children are females if it is known that the elder child is a female is:
Let A and B are two mutually exclusive events and if \(P(A)\) = 0.5 and \( P(\bar B)\) = 0.6 then P(AUB) is:
The probability of getting 53 Sundays in a leap year is:
The probability of getting the number 6 at least once in a regular die if it can roll it 6 times?
On his vacation, Rahul visits four cities (A, B, C, and D) in random order. The probability that he visits A first and B last is:

A six-faced die is a biased one. It is thrice more likely to show an odd number than to show an even number. It is thrown twice. The probability that the sum of the numbers in the two throws is even is:
A box contains 5 green pencils and 7 yellow pencils. Two pencils are chosen at random from the box without replacement. What is the probability they are both yellow?
A bag contains 10 black and 20 white balls, If one ball is drawn at random, what is the probability that the ball is white?
A bag contains 5 white, 4 black, and 6 red balls. If 2 balls are drawn one by one without replacement, find the probability of getting all white balls.
From a pack of playing card, one card is drawn randomly. What is the probability that the card is red color or king?
A card is drawn at random from an ordinary deck of 52 playing cards. The probability that it is a 10 or a spade is:

A bag contains 4 white and 2 black balls and another bag contains 3 white and 5 black balls. If one ball is drawn from each bag, then the probability of one ball is white and the other ball being black is:
In a drawer, there are 5 white (W) socks, 4 red (R) socks and 3 green (G) socks. Two socks are picked randomly. What is the possibility that both the socks are of same color?
A lot of 4 white and 4 red balls is randomly divided into two halves. What is the probability that there will be 2 red and 2 white balls in each half?
It has been found if \(A\) and B play a game 12 times, A wins 6 times, B wins 4 times and they draw twice. A and B take part in a series of 3 games. The probability that they win alternately is:
A box contains 2 blue caps, 4 red caps, 5 greens caps and 1 yellow cap. If four caps are picked at random, the probability that none of them is green is:
A point is chosen at random inside a rectangle measuring 6 inches by 5 inches. What is the probability that the randomly selected point is at least one inch from the edge of the rectangle?
